sn50.55-66:2.1: 6 Another Chapter of Abbreviated Texts on the Ganges, etc.
sn50.55-66:4.1: “Mendicants, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn50.55-66:4.2: In the same way, a mendicant who develops the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn50.55-66:4.3: And how does a mendicant who develops the five powers slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?
sn50.55-66:4.4: It’s when a mendicant develops the powers of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom culminating in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn50.55-66:4.5: That’s how a mendicant who develops the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
sn50.55-66:7.1: Six on slanting to the east,
sn50.55-66:7.2: and six on slanting to the ocean;
sn50.55-66:7.4: and that’s how this chapter is recited.
